meta.title: FAQ | OpenEconomy - Common Questions Answered
meta.description: Find answers to common questions about OpenEconomy. Learn about signing up, setting your value, trust and safety, and how fair skill exchange works.

hero.headline: Frequently Asked Questions
hero.subheadline: Everything you need to know about OpenEconomy. Can't find what you're looking for? Ask in our Discord.

items.question: What is OpenEconomy?
items.answer: OpenEconomy is a platform for fair skill exchange. Instead of paying money for services, you trade skills with others based on time-value equivalence. For example: 4 hours of gardening at $25/hr = 2.5 hours of cooking at $40/hr. Both equal $100 in value—fair exchange.

items.question: Is it free to use?
items.answer: Yes, completely free. We don't charge fees, take a percentage of exchanges, or have premium tiers. OpenEconomy is non-profit and community-funded through donations.

items.question: How do I sign up?
items.answer: Click 'Get Started' and create an account with your email or by connecting a crypto wallet. Then set your hourly value, add your skills, and you're ready to exchange. Takes about 5 minutes.

items.question: Do I need any special skills?
items.answer: Everyone has valuable skills! Cooking, gardening, tutoring, pet sitting, handyman work, design, coding, language teaching, elder care—anything you can do that others need counts.

items.question: Is this available in my country?
items.answer: OpenEconomy is global and available everywhere with internet access. However, most exchanges happen locally, so the experience depends on how many participants are in your area.

items.question: How do I decide my hourly value?
items.answer: Your hourly value (baseline) is what you believe your time is worth. If you have a job, divide your annual salary by 2,000 hours. If not, consider what someone with your skills would reasonably earn. You can change it anytime.

items.question: What if someone's rate is much higher than mine?
items.answer: That's fine! The math still works. If they charge $100/hr and you charge $25/hr, you'd provide 4 hours for every 1 hour they provide. Different time, same value, fair exchange.

items.question: What if an exchange isn't perfectly balanced?
items.answer: Small imbalances are normal and tracked as credit/debit. If you receive $10 more value than you provided, you have -$10 credit. It evens out across multiple exchanges over time.

items.question: Can I exchange without giving something back immediately?
items.answer: Yes! You can 'bank' credit by providing services now and receiving services later from anyone in the community. Your balance can be negative (you owe) or positive (community owes you).

items.question: How do I know people are trustworthy?
items.answer: Every participant has a visible reputation: Trust tier, completion rate, average rating, reviews, and time on platform. Start with Trusted or higher participants if you're cautious.

items.question: What if someone doesn't complete their part?
items.answer: 1. Try to communicate and resolve directly. 2. If that fails, raise a dispute. 3. A neutral mediator reviews the case. 4. If unresolved, a council of Champions decides.

items.question: What if someone is inappropriate or harasses me?
items.answer: Report them immediately through the platform or Discord moderators. We take harassment seriously. Offenders face warnings, suspension, or permanent removal depending on severity.

items.question: Is my personal information safe?
items.answer: We collect minimal data and never sell it. You control what's visible on your profile. Exchanges are recorded on blockchain for transparency, but only wallet addresses—not personal details—are public.

items.question: Do I need cryptocurrency to use OpenEconomy?
items.answer: No! You can sign up with just email. The blockchain runs in the background for transparency and trust, but you never need to buy, hold, or understand crypto.

items.question: What blockchain do you use?
items.answer: We use Polygon (and plan to add Base) for recording exchanges. These are low-cost, environmentally-friendly blockchains. Users never pay gas fees—we cover all blockchain costs.

items.question: Is the code open source?
items.answer: Yes, completely. Everything is on GitHub: github.com/openeconomy/trade. You can review, fork, or contribute to any part of the project.

items.question: Is there a mobile app?
items.answer: Not yet. The website is mobile-responsive and works well on phones. Native iOS and Android apps are planned for a future phase.

items.question: How do I find people in my area?
items.answer: Use the Discover page and filter by location. You can also join or create a local community to connect with nearby participants.

items.question: Can I create a private group?
items.answer: Yes! You can create communities with different visibility: Public (anyone can join), Approval (admin approves), or Invite-only. Requires Trusted tier to create communities.

items.question: How can I help build OpenEconomy?
items.answer: Many ways! Code (contribute on GitHub), Design (help with UI/UX), Community (moderate, translate, create content), or Financial (donate to keep us running). See our Contribute page.
